first_reading.text:
[[Rm 4,1]]Brothers and sisters: What then can we say that Abraham found, our ancestor according to the flesh?
[[Rm 4,2]]Indeed, if Abraham was justified on the basis of his works, he has reason to boast; but this was not so in the sight of God.
[[Rm 4,3]]For what does the scripture say? "Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness."
[[Rm 4,4]]A worker's wage is credited not as a gift, but as something due.
[[Rm 4,5]]But when one does not work, yet believes in the one who justifies the ungodly, his faith is credited as righteousness.
[[Rm 4,6]]So also David declares the blessedness of the person to whom God credits righteousness apart from works:
[[Rm 4,7]]"Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven and whose sins are covered.
[[Rm 4,8]]Blessed is the man whose sin the Lord does not record."
first_reading.title: Letter to the Romans

psalm.text:
[[Ps 32,1]]Blessed is he whose fault is taken away, 
whose sin is covered.
[[Ps 32,2]]Blessed the man to whom the LORD imputes not guilt, 
in whose spirit there is no guile.

[[Ps 32,5]]Then I acknowledged my sin to you, 
my guilt I covered not. 
I said, “I confess my faults to the LORD,” 
and you took away the guilt of my sin.

[[Ps 32,11]]Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, you just; 
exult, all you upright of heart.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Lc 12,1]]At that time: So many people were crowding together that they were trampling one another underfoot. He began to speak, first to his disciples, "Beware of the leaven--that is, the hypocrisy--of the Pharisees.
[[Lc 12,2]]There is nothing concealed that will not be revealed, nor secret that will not be known.
[[Lc 12,3]]Therefore whatever you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered behind closed doors will be proclaimed on the housetops.
[[Lc 12,4]]I tell you, my friends, do not be afraid of those who kill the body but after that can do no more.
[[Lc 12,5]]I shall show you whom to fear. Be afraid of the one who after killing has the power to cast into Gehenna; yes, I tell you, be afraid of that one.
[[Lc 12,6]]Are not five sparrows sold for two small coins? Yet not one of them has escaped the notice of God.
[[Lc 12,7]]Even the hairs of your head have all been counted. Do not be afraid. You are worth more than many sparrows."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
